00016 package PGresponsegroup;
00017 
00018 use strict;
00019 use Exporter;
00020 use PGcore  qw(not_null) ;
00021 use PGanswergroup;
00022 use Tie::IxHash;
00023 
00024 #############################################
00025 # An object which contains the student response(s)
00026 # 1. needs to be able to hold one or more responses
00027 # 2. needs space for auxiliary answer labels
00028 #      for example all of the entries in an array
00029 # 3. needs to coordinate answer labels with the PGanswergroup holding it
00030 #    We'll accomplish this by having it point to it's enclosing answergroup
00031 # 4. may have additional methods for processing and storing response strings
00032 #      the responses for radio buttons should be of the form   response_label=>[button1, button2, button3,  ...]
00033 # 5. should be called with at least one label, response pair
00034 # 6. By convention the first response usually has the same label as the parent answergroup.
00035 #    This is always true if there is only a single response.
00036 #############################################
00037 our @ISA= qw(PGanswergroup);
00038 
00039 ###
00040 # new ( label, response, label, response)
00041 #
00042 # create a new empty response group object
00043 # Optionally append label/response pairs
00044 ###
00045 sub new {
00046     my $class = shift;
00047     my $answergroup_label = shift;
00048     my $self = {
00049         answergroup_label  => $answergroup_label,    # enclosing answergroup that created this responsegroup
00050         response_order     => [],         # response labels
00051         responses          => {},         # response label/response value pair, 
00052                                      # value could be an arrayref in the case of radio or checkbox groups        
00053     };
00054     bless $self, $class;
00055     $self->append_responses(@_);
00056     return $self;
00057         
00058 }
00059 ###############
00060 # append_response (label, response)
00061 #
00062 # Append label/response pairs to the response hash.
00063 # order is recorded in the response_order array
00064 ###############
00065 
00066 sub append_response{
00067 
00068     my $self = shift;
00069     my $response_label = shift;
00070     my $response_value =shift;
00071     if (not_null($response_label) ) {
00072         if (not exists ($self->{responses}->{$response_label}) ) {
00073             push @{ $self->{response_order}} , $response_label;
00074             $self->{responses}->{$response_label} = $response_value;
00075         } else {
00076             $self->internal_debug_message( "PGresponsegroup::append_response error: there is already an answer labeled $response_label", caller(2),"\n");
00077         }
00078     } else {
00079             $self->internal_debug_message(  "PGresponsegroup::append_response error: undefined or empty response label");
00080     }
00081     #warn "\n content of responses  is ",join(' ',%{$self->{responses}});
00082 }
00083 
00084 ###############
00085 # append_response (label, response, label, responses)
00086 #
00087 # Append label/response pairs to the response hash.
00088 # order is recorded in the response_order array
00089 ###############
00090 
00091 sub append_responses {   #no error checking
00092     my $self = shift;
00093     my @response_list  = @_;
00094     #warn "working with @response_list,", caller(2);
00095     while (@response_list) {
00096         $self->append_response(shift @response_list , shift @response_list);
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 ################
00101 # replace_response(label, response)
00102 #
00103 # replace the response to one response label entry
00104 ################
00105 sub replace_response {
00106     my $self = shift;
00107     my $response_label = shift;
00108     my $response_value = shift;
00109     if (defined $self->{responses}->{$response_label}) {  
00110         $self->{responses}->{$response_label}=$response_value if defined $response_value;
00111         return $self->{responses}->{$response_label};
00112     } else {
00113         warn "response label |$response_label| not defined" ;
00114         return undef;
00115     }
00116 }
00117 ################
00118 # extend_response(label, response)
00119 #
00120 # extend the annonymous response to one response label entry  -- used for check boxes and radio buttons
00121 ################
00122 sub extend_response {
00123     my $self = shift;
00124     my $response_label = shift;
00125     my $new_value_key  = shift;
00126     my $selected       = shift;
00127     if (defined $self->{responses}->{$response_label}) {  
00128         my $response_value = $self->{responses}->{$response_label};     
00129         !defined($response_value) && do{ $response_value = {} };
00130         ref($response_value) !~/HASH/ && do{ 
00131                     $self->internal_debug_message("PGresponsegroup::extend_response: error in storing hash ", ref($response_value),$response_value);
00132                     $response_value = {$response_value=>$selected};
00133                   }; 
00134             #should not happen this means that a non-hash entry was made into this response label
00135             # this converts it to a hash entry           
00136         $response_value->{$new_value_key} =  $selected;
00137         $self->{responses}->{$response_label} = $response_value;
00138         return $response_value;  
00139         # a hash of key/value pairs -- the key labels the radio button or checkbox, 
00140         # the value whether it is selected
00141     } else {
00142         $self->internal_debug_message("PGresponsegroup::extend_response: response label |$response_label| not defined") ;
00143         return undef;
00144     }
00145     
00146 }
00147 ################
00148 # get_response(label)
00149 #
00150 # returns  response for that label entry
00151 ################
00152 sub get_response {
00153     my $self = shift;
00154     my $response_label = shift;
00155     $self->{responses}->{$response_label};
00156 }
00157 sub get_answergroup_label {
00158     my $self = shift;
00159     if ( ! not_null ($self->{answergroup_label}) ) { #if $answergroup is not yet defined
00160         $self->{answergroup_label} = ${$self->{response_order}}[0];
00161     }
00162     if ( not_null ($self->{answergroup_label}) ) { #if $answergroup is now defined
00163         return $self->{answergroup_label};
00164     } else {
00165         warn "This answer group has no labeled responses.";
00166     }
00167 }

00169     
00170 
00171         
00172 
00173 ################
00174 # clear()
00175 #
00176 # sets PGresponse group to empty
00177 ################
00178 sub clear {
00179     my $self = shift;
00180     $self->{response_order}=[];
00181     $self->{responses} ={};
00182 }
00183 ################
00184 # response_labels()
00185 #
00186 # returns entry ordered list of response labels
00187 ################
00188 
00189 
00190 sub response_labels {
00191     my $self = shift;
00192     @{$self->{response_order}};
00193 }
00194 
00195 ################
00196 #values()
00197 #
00198 # returns entry ordered list of response values
00199 ################
00200 
00201 sub values {
00202     my $self = shift;
00203     my @out = ();
00204     foreach my $key ( @{$self->{response_order}} ) {
00205         push @out, $self->get_response($key);
00206     }
00207     @out;
00208 }
00209 # synonym for values
00210 sub responses {
00211     my $self = shift;
00212     $self->values(@_);
00213 }
00214 
00215 sub data {
00216     my $self = shift;
00217     return { %$self };
00218 }
00219 1;
